tei:titleStmt.tei:title: Phantom Lady, Vol. 17, April 1948
tei:titleStmt.tei:author: Ruth Ann Roche
Clarence Matthew Baker
tei:titleStmt.tei:editor: [If the comic or graphic novel has an editor, use this tag to record the name]

tei:editionStmt.tei:edition: Initial release of the Phantom Lady #17 file

tei:availability.tei:licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 Unported License
Declared by Digital Comic Museum public domain legal status

tei:notesStmt.tei:note: OCR scanning accomplished using Google Cloud Vision API
Most of the text was double-keyed, however
Quality of JPEGs improved using Graphic Converter v.10

tei:author.tei:note: Writing under the pseudonym "Gregory Page." Writer of "The Soda Mint Killer!" and "The Stinging Whip!". Writer of "Evelyn Ellis" is unknown. Source:https://www.comics.org/issue/6644/ ; https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ruth_Roche_(comics)
For "The Soda Mint Killer!" and "The Stinging Whip!", incl. the cover. Illustrator for "Evelyn Ellis" is unknown. Source:https://www.comics.org/issue/6644/

tei:projectDesc.tei:p: A 1948 Phantom Lady comic encoded using TEI/CBML in order to support advanced text and image mining techniques for a JMU class, used as a course template file

CBML, "Comic Book Markup Language" was developed by John Walsh (Indiana U.) for the analysis of comic books. To the default TEI elements, it adds "panel" with the custom attribute "characters", and includes the subelements "balloon" for direct speech, thought, etc. and "caption". "Panels" are usually grouped according to what is visible on a single printed page using "tei:div" elements with the attributes "panelGrp" and identifying "n" (number).

tei:interpretation.tei:p: The visual details and action of the comic have been described in declarative prose by the encoders in note elements that refer to either individual panels (type="panelDesc") or a panel group as a whole (type="panelGrpDesc").

tei:normalization.tei:p: No attempt has been made to normalize the found-text spelling conventions
No attempt has been made to normalize the found-text capitalization conventions

tei:tagsDecl.tei:rendition: font-style: letter inhabiting a contrasting box;

tei:taxonomy.tei:bibl: Library of Congress Thesaurus for Graphic Materials

tei:revisionDesc.tei:change: initial encoding of Phantom Lady #17 is complete

tei:interpGrp.tei:desc: a structured note field for transportation types
a structured note field for communication devices
a structured note field for (binary) gender marking
a structured note field for weapon types
a structured note field for uniforms
types of speech in a cbml:balloon element

The interp elements below include vocabulary that may be used to characterize the transition from the previous panel to the current panel. The transition types listed below are defined by Scott McCloud in his Understanding Comics (70-72)

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady, in costume, gazing sultrily at the reader, loosely bound to a wharf pier with ship's rope, holds her black-ray device in her left hand and its green case in her right. Two men in the distance are running towards her, one of whom is clutching a knife.
cbml:panel.tei:head:
This Issue!
Phantom Lady
in
"THE SODA MINT KILLER!" "THE STINGING WHIP!" Also
A TRUE CRIME STORY Narrated by
PHANTOM LADY.

tei:person.tei:note: wears sky-blue checked suit, fedora, black shirt and orange necktie, clean-shaven
wears brown round-top hat, grey suit, dark necktie, face either wrinkled with age or scarred, claen-shaven // Tony and Joe were confused by the comic book letterer
wears grey fedora with leopard-print band, matching necktie and handkerchief, green suit, clean-shaven // Tony and Joe were confused by the comic book letterer
wears brown fedora with black band, light blue or grey suit, clean-shaven

cbml:panel.tei:head: PHANTOM Lady
cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady, emerging from a coal furnace, trains her black ray on two confounded criminals. The color scheme is black, white and shades of red.
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: WHO WOULD EXPECT TO FIND SANDRA KNIGHT, A SENATOR'S DAUGHTER. WORKING IN A HASH-HOUSE? BUT SHE HAD TO, SO THAT THE PHANTOM LADY COULD SERVE JUSTICE WITH A MURDER STEW THAT WAS BEING DISHED OUT BY THE MERCILESS SODA MINT KILLER!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Sandra Knight and Don Borden are seen from behind as they walk arm-in-arm towards "Betty's Beanery".
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: NICE OF YOU TO LOAN BETTY MONEY TO GET STARTED IN BUSINESS, SANDRA. HOPE SHE CAN COOK...
SHE'S AN OLD FRIEND, DON. AND WHEN HER FATHER DIED, SHE WAS BROKE...
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: SANDRA KNIGHT, REALLY PHANTOM LADY, ARRIVES WITH DON TO HELP A FRIEND...

cbml:panel.tei:note: In a circular panel, one thug holds Betty while another slugs her on the jaw. The spatial line tracking of the slug matches the shape of the panel itself.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WE WARNED YOU TO PAY UP, SISTER!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: BUT INSIDE...
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: I CAN'T PAY FOR PROTECTION... OHHH..
OH, YOU CAN'T EH?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Thugs push Don and Sandra aside as they bolt out of the doorway of "Beatty's Beanery".
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HEY, YOU..
OUT OF OUR WAY, CHUM...
OHH! THEY'VE HURTBETTY!

tei:fw.tei:emph: NEXT ISSUE--'PHANTOM LADY'--ON SALE 2ND WEEK IN APRIL

cbml:panel.tei:note: Don and Sandra, kneeling on the floor, help the beaten Beatty as she cradles her head.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WHAT'S THE MATTER WITH ME? I SHOULD HAVE SLUGGED THEM!
OHH... THOSE MEN...
YOU'LL BE ALL RIGHT, BETTY... BUT WHAT'S IT ALL ABOUT?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Betty, cradling her head with her other hand, holds a card in her left hand, fingers splayed, while she looks down at the tabletop, sitting in a booth.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SEE THIS CARD. I HAVE TO PAY THEM MONEY OR CLOSE UP! AND I CAN'T EVEN AFFORD TO HIRE ANY HELP. I MIGHT AS WELL GIVE UP.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Full profile shot of Sandra as she examines the mobster's card, with one foot extending into a lower panel, with Don and the downcast Betty all sitting in a booth.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HMM... ACME PROTECTIVE ASSOCIATION!
THE OLD PROTECTION RACKET! MIGHT BE A JOB FOR PHANTOM LADY IN THIS

cbml:panel.tei:note: In a circular panel interrupted by the next one, headshots of Don and Sandra facing the unseen Betty, with Don putting on a busboy's hat. Don's head is below Sandra's.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: CHEER UP, BETTY! YOU'VE JUST GOT TWO TEMPORARY ASSISTANTS! AND IF THOSE TOUGH CHARACTERS COME BACK, I'LL HANDLE THEM!
A WONDERFUL IDEA, DON! I'LL WAIT ON TABLE!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Sandra, wearing a black dress and apron, strides across the foreground carrying a heavy load of dishes, making eye contact with Don to place an order. A couple sit on barstools at the counter.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: DRAW TWO, BLACK!
GET HER!
COMING UP!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: AND SOON.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Sandra places a dish she has just washed atop a huge stack. She is seen from behind, the ribs on her stockings prominently displayed.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: NOTHING FUNNY ABOUT THIS! BUT IF IT HELPS BETTY... AND IF PHANTOM LADY IS NEEDED, SHE'LL BE RIGHT ON HAND!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Sandra, throwing her back into mopping, faces the reader.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: DARNED IF I DON'T WISH THEY WOULD SHOW UP! GET ME AWAY FROM THIS MOP!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Behind the glass window-door of "Acme Protective Assoc., Inc." three silhouetted figures talk.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: BUT I TELL YA, MINTS, THE DAME WON'T PAY!
SOME COLLECTORS I GOT! AND ME WITH A STOMACH THAT'S KILLING ME!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: AND ACROSS TOWN...

cbml:panel.tei:note: Headshot of Soda Mint Killer popping a soda mint into his mouth.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: OOO... MY INDIGESTION! BUT SICK AS I AM, I'LL SHOW YOU STUPIDS HOW TO COLLECT FROM A DAME!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Elevated shot of three criminals conversing outside of "Betty's Beanery".
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: REMEMBER, EASY DOES IT! WE'RE CUSTOMERS!
AN' THE CUSTOMER'S ALWAYS RIGHT, EH, MINTS? WE GOTCHA!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: NO TIME IS LOST BY THE SLICK GANG... A 'MISSION' IS UNDER WAY...

cbml:panel.tei:note: Inside the diner, the members of the Soda mint Gang sit at a booth, while Don Borden is behind the counter and Sandra Knight is standing in front of the counter
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: AW... MORE CUSTOMERS... AND I'M ABOUT TO DROP ON MY FEET!
WOUNDN'T THEY? JUST AT CLOSING TIME! WELL, AFTER THEY LEAVE, WE'RE LOCKING THE DOORS! I'M TOO TIRED TO KEEP THIS UP!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Sandra, attempting to wait on table, is grabbed around the waist by one of the Soda Mint Gang members
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WHAT'LL IT BE? HEY...!
COME HERE, CUTIE! YOU LOOK GOOD ENOUGH TO EAT!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Sandra's hand is breaking a plate over the offending Soda Mint Gang member's head.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: OH DO I? WELL, I SUGGEST YOU TRY THE SPECIALITY OF THE HOUSE, WISE GUY!

cbml:panel.tei:note: As the offending Soda Mint Gang member pulls a knife, Sandra Knight backs away, eyes wide with terror. Don's silhouette is visible behind.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: NOW, WAS THAT NICE? OF COURSE, IF YOU WANNA PLAY ROUGH...
OH, DON, H - HELP! HE'S GOT A KNIFE!
SANDRA!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Sandra Knight is struggling in the grasp of a Soda Mint Gang member, who is brandishing a knife, while Don Borden races to the rescue.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: I'M COMING, SANDRA!
YOU BRUTE, I'LL...
...CHANGE TO PHANTOM LADY IF I GET THE CHANCE...
YOU'LL WHAT?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Sandra Knight is freed as both Soda Mint Gang members beset Don Borden, one with knife in hand, the other wielding a pipe. Betty is racing towards the scene.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: PIPE TH' HERO, JOE!
YEAH! LEAD PIPE HIM!
UGHHH...
OHHH... THEY PLAY ROUGH! POOR DON!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Betty accusingly addresses Sandra as she bolts out of the room.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SANDRA! DESERTING US!
THIS LOOKS BAD, RUNNING AWAY, BUT I MUST FIND A PLACE TO CHANGE INTO PHANTOM LADY!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Betty shrinks away, melodrammatially, from the Soda Mint Killer, who is threatening her with a dish towel knotted in his hands. DOn Borden is being punched in the face by a gang member.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: NO... DON'T..
SO YOU WON'T PAY, EH, SISTER? OKAY... I BEEN NEEDIN' SOMEONE TO USE AS AN EXAMPLE TO THE OTHERS!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Standing behind her, the Soda Mint Killer strangles Betty with the dish towel.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HURRY IT UP, CHUM! AN' PUT THE GUY'S HANDS ON HER THROAT!
SURE! LET THE CHUMP TAKE THE RAP!

cbml:panel.tei:note: The Soda Mint Killer tosses a soda mint into his mouth as he speaks.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: C'MON! WE'RE IN THE CLEAR... THE OTHER DAME HELPED US BY TAKIN' A POWDER!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Sandra Knight, now costumed as Phantom Lady, races back into Beatty's Beanery.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HOPE I'M NOT TOO LATE TO SETTLE SOME CROOK'S HASH!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: BUT EVEN THEN...

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady looks aghast at Beatty's corpse and Don's unconscious body.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: BETTY! THEY'VE KILLED HER! AND DON!... WHAT'S THAT CARD?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Headshot of Phantom Lady reading the criminal protection racket card.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: AT LEAST DON'S BREATHING! WHAT'S THIS? ACME PROTECTIVE ASSOCIATION! THE SAME CROOKS! NICE OF THEM TO PUT THEIR PHONE NUMBER DOWN HERE!

cbml:panel.tei:note: A weaving drunk enters the diner as Phantom Lady cradles a telephone receiver to her ear, with Don's and Beatty's bodies heaped up in the drunk's path..
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: BUT AS PHANTOM LADY TALKS TO THE OPERATOR...
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SHAY...I WANNA SCHANWICH... HUH! DEAD PEOPLE! YEOWIE! LOTS OF DEAD PEOPLE!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady rushes out the door as the mental processes of the drunk begin to register, who is now foregrounded.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: PHANTOM LADY! YOU DID IT! YOU KILLED THE POOR DEAD PEOPLE!
TAKE IT EASY, CHUM, DON'T SPRAIN YOUR BRAIN! JUST CALL THE POLICE FOR ME!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Narrow panel with tottering drunk, full-length, cries for help.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: MURDER! HELP! POLICE! HELP! SAVE ME FROM THE PHANTOM LADY!

cbml:panel.tei:note: One policeman helps a woosey Don up from the floor, Beatty's body beside him, as another one props up the weaving drunk.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: PHANTOM LADY A KILLER! I DON'T BELIEVE IT!
THIS IS THE GUY THAT DID IT! YOU'RE COMING WITH US, MY LITTLE RUM BLOSSOM!
OHHH... MY HEAD!

cbml:panel.tei:note: A member of the Soda Mint Killer gang watches Phantom Lady roar off in her fancy covertible.
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: WHILE FROM ACROSS THE STREET A GUARD POSTED BY MINTS SEES PHANTOM LADY DRIVE AWAY..
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: OH-OH! BETTER CALL MINTS AN' WARN HIM! HE'S GOT A SMART LOOK ON HER PAN, TOO!

cbml:panel.tei:note: The gang member is about to enter a telephone in a public space, perhaps a bank lobby.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: GLAD I WON'T BE THERE WHEN SHE ARRIVES! THAT DAME IS POISON!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Telephone-booth-panel-shot of the gang member talking into a telephone receiver.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YEAH, MINTS! AN' I THINK SHE'S GOIN TO YOUR PLACE! AND SHE LOOKS LIKE TROUBLE!

cbml:panel.tei:note: The Soda Mint Killer slams the telephone receiver in his office as he barks orders to his two henchmen.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: GET MOVING YOU GUYS! PHANTOM LADY'S ON HER WAY HERE, AN' I WANNA GIVE HER A WARM WELCOME!
THAT'S BAD!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Opening a tall metal locker, the henchmen handle army surplus weapons.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SMARTEST THING MINTS DID WAS TO BUY UP THIS OLD EQUIPMENT FROM TH' ARMY SURPLUS! LOOKIT THIS NICE BAZOOKA!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Viewpoint from the Soda Mint Killer's left elbow reveals one criminal juggling two hand-grenades.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: AN' THESE PRETTY PINEAPPLES! HOPE TH' PHANTOM LADY LIKES FRUIT SALAD!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Standing in front of the metal lockers, the Soda Mint Killer tosses a mint into his mouth, echoing the playful behavior of his underling in the last panel.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: EASY WITH THOSE THINGS, BOYS! WE WANNA WIN THIS WAR WITH PHANTOM LADY WID 'EM!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady's convertible stops in front of a fenced-off construction scene.
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: SUDDENLY, AT THE END OF THE STREET...
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SO THIS IS THE STREET! AND DEAD END AT THAT!

cbml:panel.tei:note: A gang member, leaning out of a window, fires a bazooka.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: ROCKETS TO YOU, PHANTOM LADY!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady's convertible explodes as she races away on foot.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YIKES! WHAT WAS THAT?..A BOMB? MY POOR CAR!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Action shot of Phantom Lady leaping into a "foxhole" with hair flying upwards.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: A FOXHOLE COMES IN HANDY DURING A WAR! JUST THE PLACE FOR ME TO GET OUT OF THE PATH OF THOSE FIREWORKS!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Cut to two gang members, one of whom has just thrown something.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WE GOT HER CORNERED NOW!
NEVER MIND THE GAB, KEEP AFTER HER! KEEP HER CORNERED!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Explosions pockmark the landscape as Phantom Lady crouches in her exposed "foxhole".
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: NOT AS MUCH COVER AS I THOUGHT! GOT TO GET OUT OF HERE!

cbml:panel.tei:note: She crawls into a large metal culvert.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: MIGHT BE A LITTLE MORE PROTECTION IN HERE UNTIL THINGS COOL OFF!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Venturing into the culvert with hands against the sides, the artist captures the darkness by using blue and black inks.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THIS IS MORE LIKE IT! THOSE BULLETS CAN'T GET IN HERE!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Cut to a hand-grenade landing near the open culvert.
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: BUT PHANTOM LADY DIDN'T RECKON ON HAND GRENADES..

cbml:panel.tei:note: Exploding rocks and earth mark the detonation.
The panel is unrelieved black save for PL's speech balloon.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: A CAVE-IN! I'M TRAPPED! GOT TO KEEP GOING FORWARD! BUT WHERE?

cbml:panel.tei:note: She kneels in the darkness, hands outspread, while a rat leaps across the foreground.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: UGH! SEWER RATS!

cbml:panel.tei:note: PL crawls on her hands and knees through the dark culvert.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: I'LL JUST FOLLOW MISTER RAT... MAYBE HE KNOWS A WAY OUT OF THIS IRON LUNG!

cbml:panel.tei:note: PL emerges from the culvert in a raw earthen pit in a basement.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WELL, HOW DO YOU LIKE THAT, A BASEMENT! LOOKS LIKE A LOFT BUILDING!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Male-clad legs move down the basement stairs as PL casts about for a hiding place.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: OH-OH! DIDN'T GET MUCH OF A CHANCE TO LOOK THINGS OVER, DID I?

cbml:panel.tei:note: PL crawls backwards into a cold metal furnace.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: OUT OF THE FIRING LINE INTO THE FURNACE! BUT AT LEAST IT'S A PLACE TO LOOK AND LISTEN!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Two gang members stand in front of the open furnace with a box full of papers.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: BOY, THE COPS WOULD JUST LOVE THESE RECORDS!
LEAVE IT TO MINTS TO FIGURE OUT HOW TO GET RID OF 'EM! COME ON, DUMP 'EM AN' LET'S BLOW!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Closeup of the papers being dumped into the furnace as another hand brings the flame of a cigarette lighter near.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: IN A WAY IT'S SILLY TO WORRY ABOUT COPS NOW THAT WE'VE KNOCKED OFF THE PHANTOM LADY! BUT ORDERS IS ORDERS!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Long shot of the two criminals in silhouette backing away from the sneezing furnace.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HEY! THE FURNACE SNEEZED!
YOU'RE NUTS! LET'S GO!
ACHOO!

cbml:panel.tei:note: PL emerges from the furnace, shining her black ray at the fleeing criminals.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: PHANTOM LADY! YEOW! SOMETHING'S HAPPENED TO MY EYES! I'M BLIND!
HELP! ME TOO! CAN'T SEE! DON'T KILL US!
JUST A MINUTE, BOYS! DID I EVER SHOW YOU MY FAMOUS BLACK RAY?

cbml:panel.tei:note: PL unhooks a metal coal rake from the wall.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: DON'T WORRY, I WOULDN'T CHEAT.. ESPECIALLY THE ELECTRIC CHAIR!

cbml:panel.tei:note: The Soda Mint Killer arms a hand-grenade with his teeth while watching PL bash a gang member over the head with the coal rake.
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: BUT MINTS ONLY HAS STOMACH TROUBLE, THERE'S NOTHING THE MATTER WITH HIS EYES OR EARS...
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: POIFECT! I GET RID OF PHANTON LADY AN' THOSE LUGS ALL IN ONE FLIP OF MY WRIST!

cbml:panel.tei:note: The Soda Mint Killer lobs the grenade at PL as he leaps down the basement stairs.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: COMING AT YOU, CUTIE! TOO BAD YOU HAVE TO CROAK SO YOUNG!
OH-OH!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Full-length shot of PL expertly fielding the grenade in mid-air, legs of an unconscious criminal next to the furnace with flames in its grating..
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: ONE CHANCE... IF I CAN FIELD THIS THING BEFORE IT EXPLODES!

cbml:panel.tei:note: PL athletically throws the grenade at the back of the fleeing Soda Mint Killer.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WHAT'S YOUR HURRY? CAN'T A LADY RETURN A COMPLIMENT?

cbml:panel.tei:note: A head-on vista of the surprised Soda Mint Killer propelled through the air, with a yellow and red explosion cloud behind.
Silhouettes of PL talking to a cop, his hands on his waist, with two corpses under sheets in the foreground.
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: SOON...
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WOW! LOOKS LIKE A CYCLONE HIT THIS PLACE!
IT DID, BUT I HAD TO CLEAR DON OF POOR BEATTY'S MURDER!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Sandra Knight, wearing a low-cut red dress, sits behind the wheel of a convertible while Don strides down the "City Jail" entryway staircase.
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: AND...
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: DID YOU HEAR, SANDRA? PHANTOM LADY CAUGHT THE CROOKS AND CLEARED ME! IF ONLY I COULD SEE HER AND EXPRESS MY GRATITUDE!
WELL, YOU MIGHT TAKE ME OUT, I'LL TRY TO SUBSTITUTE FOR PHANTOM LADY.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady, foregrounded in a burning stable, looks startled as a mounted jockey tries to stab her with a poisoned riding crop
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: PHANTOM LADY HAD LITTLE EXPERIENCE WTH BANGTALS BUT PLENTY WITH MURDER, YET IT TOOK FAST THINKING AND ACTING TO KEEP UP WITH THE ADVENTURE OF "THE STINGING WHIP!"

cbml:panel.tei:note: Headshot of Don Borden speaking into a telephone receiver
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: CAN'T TELL YOU NOW, SANDRA, BUT MEET ME AT THE GRAND FAIRGROUNDS TRACK BEFORE THE FIRST RACE THIS AFTERNOON!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: SANDRA KNIGHT'S BOY FRIEND, DON BORDEN, IS BUBBLING OVER WITH SURPRISE...

cbml:panel.tei:note: Sandra Knight, sprawled across a sofa, speaks into a telephone receiver, smiling broadly
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: A SURPRISE, EH? BETTER BE GOOD! I'LL BE THERE...
AND SO WILL THE PHANTOM LADY! THINGS HAVE BEEN PRETTY DULL FOR HER LATELY!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Full length shot of Sandra Knight striding towards the viewer at the racetrack, wearing a green dress, matching dress hat with a green feather, white gloves, and necklace, clutching a purse in one hand
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WELL, HERE I AM... NOW WHERE'S DON AND THAT TERRIFIC SURPRISE OF HIS!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: THAT AFTERNOON...

cbml:panel.tei:note: With a crowd of anonymous horse-race attendees along the panel bottom, a full-length shot of Sandra Knight, her bare legs spilling halfway into the panel beneath, slews her head around with a big smile as Don taps her on the shoulder.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: COME ON, BEAUTIFUL! THAT SURPRISE IS WAITING!
OH! IT'S ABOUT TIME YOU SHOWED UP!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: BUT AS HE SITS AT THE TABLE...

cbml:panel.tei:note: Almost dragging her, Don races in front of the Pari Mutuel counter with SK in tow by her leg hand.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: RIGHT THIS WAY... TO THE STABLES!
STABLES?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Frontal shot as Don points animately at something "off-panel".
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THERE! HOW'S THAT?
OOOOH! DON! BEAUTIFUL!

cbml:panel.tei:note: narrow panel of a horse's head projecting from a stable half-door.
SK faces Don with Sugar Girl's head cradled in her gloved hands.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SUGAR GIRL, SHE'S MINE AND SHE'S RUNNING IN THE FOURTH RACE!
I CAN'T GET USED TO IT! YOU A HORSE RACING MAN!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Ground perspective as a jockey waves hello to Don, SK's high-heeled shoes and silk stockings prominently foregrounded.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: AND HERE'S MY JOCKEY! HI THERE, MICKEY!
HELLO, MISTER BORDEN!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Headshot of a grinning jockey.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HOW'S OUR WINNER, MISTER BORDEN?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Front shot of dapper Don in foreground with SK, looking perplexed, shrugging with with hands.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: BET YOUR ROLL ON SUGAR GIRL, SUGAR! YOU CAN'T LOSE, SHE'S A SURE THING!
I DON'T KNOW... I'M THREE MONTHS AHEAD ON MY ALLOWANCE NOW AND DAD WON'T LIKE...

cbml:panel.tei:note: Don waves a fistful of greenbacks towards the ticket counter as SK rocks back on her heels, chin cradled by one hand in perplexity.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: DON'T BE A SISSY... ON THE NOSE, SANDRA! BET EVERYTHING YOU'VE GOT!
WELL...

cbml:panel.tei:note: SK steps away from the ticket counter with a wad of tickets in her right hand, Don nearly out of the panel.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SUGER GIRL BETTER WIN, OR I'LL BE BEGGING FROM DOOR TO DOOR!
WONDER HOW MUCH PHANTOM LADY COULD PAWN HER BLACK RAY FOR?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Cut to an upwards shot of a horse-race bugler sounding his bugle.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THE THIRD RACE! IT WON'T BE LONG NOW!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Cut to a scene with a worried Mickey striding in front of the stables, hands behind his back.
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: BUT AT THAT MOMENT...
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: GEE, I DON'T KNOW WHAT TO DO! MISTER BORDEN'S BEEN SO NICE...

cbml:panel.tei:note: A horse-race fixer gestures towards a surprised Mickey with his finger.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: PSSST! MICKEY! WE GOTTA SEE YOU!
HUH?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Two horse-race fixers drag a struggling Mickey into a stable where the dishonest jockey waits.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YOU LITTLE TWO-TIMER!
QUICK! DRAG 'IM IN AN' SHUT TH' DOOR!
NO..LEMME GO!

cbml:panel.tei:note: A protesting Mickey shrinks away from the horse-race fixer, the dishonest jockey behind.
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: AND, INSIDE THE GLOOMY STABLE...
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: LISTEN, YOU LITTLE BUM! NOSEY IS RIDING BLACK ACE AND SUGAR GIRL IS THE ONLY HORSE WHO CAN GIVE HER TROUBLE! NOW YOU PLAY THIS RIGHT, SEE?
I TELL YOU, NO! I AIN'T GONNA THROW NO RACE! I QUIT THAT STUFF LONG AGO!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Portrait shot of a smirking dishonest jockey gripping a riding crop.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: BETTER LISTEN TO HIM, MICKEY, OR ELSE! WE GOT TWENTY THOUSAND ON BLACK ACE AND I GOT THE WHIP!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Closeup of the riding crop in the dishonest jockey's hand, revealing a knife-like projection on the end of the crop.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: ONE SHOT OF THE STUFF IN THIS NEEDLE AN' YOU ROLL OVER AND PLAY DEAD! ONLY YOU WON'T BE PLAYING!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Mickey breaks away from the horse-race fixers, while the dishonest jockey hefts his weapon.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: AW, LET'S CROAK THE LITTLE RAT!
GET OUT OF MY WAY, YOU CROOKS! IT'S ALMOST TIME FOR THE FOURTH RACE!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Mickey races at high speed from the stable, with criminals in pursuit.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: GET HIM!
I'LL GIVE HIM THE NEEDLE RIGHT NOW!
I'LL GET AWAY AND BRING THE COPS!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Mickey stumbles as he is gaffed from behind by the dishonest jockey, poisoned riding crop in hand.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: NAME YOUR POISON, CHUMP!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Huge headshot of the dishonest jockey as the silhouetted criminals drag Mickey's body into the stable.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WHAT'LL WE DO WITH THE BODY?
WHO CARES! NOW BLACK ACE IS A CINCH! THEY'LL SCRATCH SUGAR GIRL!
ACT LIKE HE'S SICK... WE'LL PUT HIM AWAY TO COOL!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: THE DEADLY POISON WORKS INSTANTLY, AND...

cbml:panel.tei:note: SK strides alongside a worried Don in front of the stable entrances.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WHAT'S THE MATTER WITH MICKEY? NO SIGN OF HIM AND IT'S ALMOST TIME FOR THE FOURTH!
WOE IS US! HOW CAN SUGAR GIRL WIN IF SHE DOESN'T RUN?
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: AND...

cbml:panel.tei:note: Don breaks into a run, losing his hat, when he espies Sugar Girl trying to bolt out of her stable.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SOMETHING'S WRONG WITH SUGAR GIRL!
SHE'S FRIGHTENED!

cbml:panel.tei:note: View from within the stable as Sugar Girl rears on her hind legs, Don throwing his arms open protectively with SK behind.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THERE, GIRL! WHAT'S WRONG, EH?
JUST LIKE A WOMAN... HAVING HYSTERICS!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Narrow panel headshot of SK with a look of horror etched on her face.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: ULLPP! OVER THERE! THINK I'LL HAVE HYSTERICS, TOO!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Inside the stable a pair of legs in equestrian boots and jodhpurs hang limply as a the shadow of a hanged man is visible behind.
SK, kneeling in the hayloft, cuts down the rope and lowers Mickey's body to Don who is waiting on the stable floor.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: POOR BOY! WHY SHOULD HE DO SUCH A THING?
IF HE DID DO IT TO HIMSELF! PHANTOM LADY, GET TO WORK!

cbml:panel.tei:note: With blue background suggesting the scene has shifted to outside, Don whirles SK around by her arm in his eagerness to have Sugar Girtl run the race.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SANDRA! YOU CAN DO IT! YOU CAN SAVE THE DAY! YOU RIDE SUGAR GIRL!
I'LL CALL THE POLICE. HEY...

cbml:panel.tei:note: SK, sitting on a wooden box in a stable, wearing a bra and the bottoms of her PL outfit, either pulls on a pair of pants or is removing her dress.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THE THINGS I GET TALKED INTO! BUT IT ONLY TAKES A FEW MINUTES... AND IT'S DON'S HORSE... AND MY MONEY!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: SANDRA ABSOLUTELY REFUSED TO RIDE SUGAR GIRL, SO...

cbml:panel.tei:note: Another panel with a portrait shot of the horse-race bugler blowing his horn.
Bird's eye view of the race contenders queuing up at the starting gate.
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: THIS IS IT... THE FOURTH RACE...

cbml:panel.tei:note: SK, wearing jockey togs, is having trouble handling Sugar Girl. The horse has a white face mask on like the other mounts, and wears a big "7" label behind the saddle.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: GOT TO GET THIS OVER WITH... THERE'S A JOB WAITING FOR PHANTOM LADY! THE MORE I THINK ABOUT IT, THE LESS I THINK MICKEY HANGED HIMSELF!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Animated headshot of the horse-race announcer shouting into a microphone cradled in his right hand.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THEY'RE OFF! SUGAR GIRL'S LEFT AT THE POST!

cbml:panel.tei:note: SK is hanging on as Sugar Girl bucks wildly.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: STEADY, GIRL! THIS IS A RACE, NOT A RODEO! COME ON NOW!

cbml:panel.tei:note: The two horse-race fixers, one with binoculars before his eyes, register annoyance when they realize that Sugar Girl is still in the race.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WHAT TH... SUGAR GIRL'S GAINING! WHERE'D THEY GET THE OTHER JOCK?
RELAX! NOSEY WILL TAKE CARE OF HIM!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: WHILE IN THE STANDS...

cbml:panel.tei:note: The dishonest jockey, looking left and backwards, sees Sugar Girl gaining on him.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THAT NEW JOCK IS GAINING! I'D BETTER USE MY WHIP AGAIN!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: AND SURE ENOUGH...

cbml:panel.tei:note: SK ducks as the dishonest jockey tries to beat her with his riding crop.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: I'M GIVING YOU A BREAK, SQUIRT! G'WAN... DROP BACK!
HEY! WHAT'S GOING ON HERE?

cbml:panel.tei:note: SK strikes the dishonest jockey smartly with her riding crop in retaliation, a red "explosion" of pain marking the impact.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: TWO CAN PLAY THAT GAME, BROTHER!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Closeup of exposed tip of the poisoned riding crop in the dishonest jockey's hand.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YOU ASKED FOR THIS, BUDDY!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Elevated shot: As Sugar Girl pulls ahead, the dishonest jockey lunges at SK with his poisoned riding crop.
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: NOSEY TRIES TO STAB SANDRA'S LEG, BUT SHE PICKS UP SPEED...

cbml:panel.tei:note: Sugar Girl faulters and loses control as SK fights to maintain her mount.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WHAT'S THE MATTER, GIRL? WHAT HAPPENED?
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: YET NOT ENOUGH SPEED..THE NEEDLE REACHED SUGAR GIRL.

cbml:panel.tei:note: SK, thrown from the saddle, flies out of the horse-race track into the surrounding greenery as Sugar Girl somersaults in the background.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: OOOH!

cbml:panel.tei:note: SK in jockey togs cradles her head as she begins to pull herself to her feet.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: OOH, MY POOR HEAD! BUT AT LEAST THIS GIVES ME A CHANCE TO CHANGE INTO THE PHANTOM LADY!

cbml:panel.tei:note: SK, now togged as PL, races towards the track.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: POOR SUGAR GIRL! NOW I'VE GOT AN IDEA OF HOW MICKEY WAS KILLED! SOMEONE'S GOING TO PAY FOR THIS!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: SO... IN LESS THAN A MINUTE...

cbml:panel.tei:note: PL leaps over a wooden restraining fence.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: BETTER START WITH THE STABLES AND LOCATE THAT JOCKEY!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Concealed behind a wall, PL watches a mounted jockey riding towards the stables.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HAH! HERE COMES MY BROKEN-NOSED CHUM NOW! BY THE LOOK OF HIM THEY DISQUALIFIED HIM!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: BUT...

cbml:panel.tei:note: PL athletically pulls herself up on to the stable roof.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: I'LL JUST GIVE HIM ONE LAST SURPRISE!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Racing across the stable roof, she keeps the riding jockey in sight.
Descending with red cape flying out behind, arms open in front, PL drops from the roof on to the terrified dishonest jockey.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HERE I AM, KILLER, READY OR NOT!
PHANTOM LADY!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Grabbing the dishonest jockey by the throat, PL drags him from his horse with the impetus of her fall.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YOU WON'T GET THE CHANCE TO USE THAT TRICK WHIP ON ME!

cbml:panel.tei:note: PL, eyes wide with surprise, is in turn grabbed around her throat by a horse-race fixer using the crook of his arm.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HUHH... WHO?
JUST RELAX, BABE ...WHILE YOU GOT THE CHANCE!

cbml:panel.tei:note: PL is dragged backwards into the stable by the two horse-race fixers, echoing Mickey's capture, with a silhouette of the dishonest jockey's profile, lip curled in anger.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: MAYBE IT WAS ON ACCOUNT OF HER WE WAS DISQUALIFIED AND LOST OUR DOUGH!
GET HER OUT OF MY SIGHT, YOU BIRD-BRAINS!

cbml:panel.tei:note: PL, thrown to the stable floor, pushes herself up on the straw as the criminals stand near the doorway, a clinched fist visible.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: AND ME WITH NO BLACK RAY! MUST THINK OF SOME WAY OUT...
GO AHEAD... GET HER!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Portrait shot of the horse-race fixer wearing a Kerry cap, brandishing a bowie knife.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: NO POISON NEEDLE FOR PHANTOM LADY!, SHE NEEDS A CLASSY EXIT! LIKE A CARVING!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Crawling across the straw on the stable floor, a wisp of smoke curls near PL's fingers.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: MY LAST CHANCE AND MATCH... NOW IF THAT STRAW WILL ONLY CATCH...

cbml:panel.tei:note: A blazing heap of straw with dark smoke billowing above, fills the panel.
The terrified dishonest jockey flees a melee of burning stable and charging, beserk horses.
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: THAT INSTANT, FLAMES THROW PANIC AMONGST THE HORSES... AS IF A SIGNAL FOR DESTRUCTION, THEY CHARGE THE GANGSTERS...

cbml:panel.tei:note: With her back to the viewer, PL directs a stream of water from a fire exhinguisher at the flames as a voice rises from a silhouette behind.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YOU AIN'T WON YET, PHANTOM LADY!
OH-OH! I THOUGHT ALL OF YOU WERE UNDER CONTROL!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: BUT...

cbml:panel.tei:note: The Kerry-cap wearing criminal throws out his arm as he is blinded by the contents of the fire extinguisher sprayed into his face by PL.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HEY! MY EYES! HELP!
WISH THIS WAS MY BLACK RAY, BUT YOU'LL HAVE TO SETTLE FOR A SQUIRT... SQUIRT!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Bird's eye view of the Kerry-cap criminal, hands rubbing his eyes, held by uniformed cops as PL sprints away.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YOU DID IT AGAIN, PHANTOM LADY!
SEE YOU SOME MORE, BOYS I'VE GOT TO MAKE A QUICK CHANGE!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: ON THE ARRIVAL OF THE POLICE, ORDER IS RESTORED...

cbml:panel.tei:note: SK, dressed again in her fancy green outfit, with one hand on hip and the other gesturing, faces the silhouette of Don holding Sugar Girl's reins.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SANDRA I'VE BEEN LOOKING EVERY WHERE FOR YOU! PHANTOM LADY FIXED EVERYTHING ... AND LOOK! SUGAR GIRL WAS ONLY STUNNED!
WONDERFUL! BUT WE'RE STILL BROKE!
COULD BE WORSE OFF, THOUGH!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: AND...

cbml:panel.tei:head:
EVELYN ELLIS
QUEEN OF GANGSTERS
cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady's disembodied head provides narrative for a tableau of smiling Evelyn Ellis and her gang menacing a group of men and women with drawn weapons
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HELLO AGAIN! AS I PROMISED LAST MONTH I'M BACK WITH ANOTHER CASE FROM POLICE FILES, A TRUE CRIME STORY, THIS TIME I'VE CHOSEN EVELYN ELLIS, THE GIRL WHO REMADE A GANG OF TWO-BIT CROOKS INTO A HIGH POWERED MOB OF DANGEROUS KILLERS. AS PHANTOM LADY LET ME ESCORT YOU AS WE LOOK IN ON THE GANG EARLY IN 1937...

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady's disembodied head provides narrative.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: ALL READY? LET'S GO TO THE SLUM DISTRICT OF SAN FRANCISCO AS FRANK ELLIS INTRODUCES HIS NEW WIFE TO HIS GANG...

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn Ellis is introduced to the card-playing seated gang members by her husband, Frankie.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HEY LOOK, IT'S FRANKIE ! WHERE YA BEEN THE LAST WEEK, PAL?
YEAH AND WHOSE THE BROAD?
HI, BOYS. I BEEN GETTIN HITCHED. MEET THE WIFE! EVELYN, MEET THE BOYS!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn gestures with her hand confidently towards the seated gang members
Evelyn snatches angrily at Tony's face.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SIT DOWN CHOWDER HEAD BEFORE I SCRATCH THOSE SQUINTY EYES OUT OF THAT THICK HEAD!
GOSH EVELYN..ER.. TAKE IT EASY WILL YA?
YIII!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Tony pulls a pistol on Evelyn as Frankie looks on.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: NO DAME IS GONNA SNATCH AT MY FACE AND GET AWAY WITH IT! SAY YOUR PRAYERS, SISTER, YOU AIN'T GOT LONG TA LIVE!
NO TONY, YOU LISTEN!
SHUT UP, FRANKIE. I DARE YOU TO PULL THAT TRIGGER! YOU HAVEN'T THE GUTS, YA CHEAP PHONEY! GO ON SHOOT!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn talks down Tony as the other gang members look on.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: AW, I CAN'T PLUG NO WOMEN!
OKAY, NOW THAT'S SETTLED. SIT DOWN AND I'LL TELL YA WHAT I GOT ON MY MIND. I GOTTA KNOW ONE THING FIRST. ARE YA WITH ME?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn sits on the table, legs prominently displayed, while speaking with the gang members
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SURE THING BABY, WITH GUTS LIKE THAT YOU'RE OKAY FOR MY DOUGH!
YEAH, ME TOO. FRANKIE DONE ALL RIGHT, HUH TONY?
HE SURE DID. COUNT ME IN.
OKAY, THEN LISTEN.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn lectures the gang with a gloved finger.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THE JOB I GOT IN MIND IS WORTH SEVENTY FIVE GRAND! WE'RE GONNA KNOCK OFF THE UNION PACIFIC EXPRESS. THEY CARRY MORE REGISTERED MAIL THAN THE POST OFFICE AND BEFORE YA OPEN YA YAPS, IT AIN'T AS HARD AS YA THINK ....

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady's disembodied head provides narrative.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: LITTLE EVELYN RULED WITH AN IRON HAND AND WITHIN A WEEK SHE HAD THE GANG WHIPPED INTO SHAPE EACH ONE'S PART REHEARSED PERFECTLY. SEE THERE THEY GO INTO THE STATION AT McAVOY. LET'S FOLLOW ....

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn threatens a seated trainman with a pistol while Frankie backs up her command.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: GET OUT OF THE CHAIR POP BEFORE IT BECOMES YA PERMANENT RESTING PLACE!
WHA... WHAT DO YOU WANT?
YOU HEARD HER, GET UP!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn pistol-whips the seated trainman as another one expresses alarm.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: OHH!
SORRY POP, WE AIN'T AIMIN' TO BE INTERRUPTED!
WHAT'S GOING ON HERE --- HEY!

cbml:panel.tei:note: The protesting trainman is held by Tony and Frankie, while Evelyn raps out orders.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YOU DIRTY RATS! HE COULDN'T EVEN HURT A FLEA!
SHUT THAT TRAP, WISE GUY, OR I'LL DO IT FOR YA! I BETTER LET HIM HAVE A LUMP TOO, WE CAN'T TAKE ANY CHANCES.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn knocks the second trainman out with her pistol, red stars and a splat mark the blow.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: LET ME GO, YOU ..UGHH!
I HOPE YOU GOT A HARD HEAD, STUPID. I DON'T WANT TO KNOCK YOUR BRAINS OUT. YOU GOT LITTLE ENOUGH AS IT IS!
HA HA! YOU KILL ME BABY WHAT A SENSE OF HUMOR!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn, gesturing with pistol in hand, directs Joe [Tony] to drag the unconscious trainman's body away.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THROW THEM INTO THE TICKET BOOTH WATCH THEM EVERY SECOND, JOE, AND IF THEY EVEN STRETCH, LET THEM HAVE IT, GET ME?
DON'T WORRY, EVELYN, THEM GUYS WON'T EVEN BLINK!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn talks to Frankie as he dons a trainman's hat. The train is seen approaching through the station window.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YA HEAR THAT, SHES COMING! GET THAT HAT ON, FRANK AND GET GOING. IF ANY THING GOES WRONG, I'LL WRING YA NECK.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Frankie stands on the train platform as the trainmen, unseen, discuss the novelty of a new agent.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HEY, SMOKY, WHERE'S THE OLD MAN? HE HASN'T MISSED A TRAIN IN TEN YEARS.
YEAH, WAIT THERE'S SOMEBODY COMING OUT NOW. LOOKS LIKE A NEW AGENT! WONDER WHAT HAPPENED?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Frankie, in disguise, attempts to allay the train engineer's suspicions.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YEAH WE HAD TO TAKE HIM TO THE HOSPITAL I GOT SOME ORDERS FOR YA!
HEY WHAT'S WRONG WITH POP? HE SICK OR SOMETHING?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Frankie pulls a gun on the engineer in the locomotive cabin, while another gunman emerges from the station.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: OKAY, HAND THEM OVER, WE HAVEN'T MUCH TIME---HEY!
GET 'EM UP FAST IF YA WANT TO LEAVE AT ALL! AND KEEP YA MITTS OFF THEM CONTROLS!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn and Pete wave their guns at a trainman heaving large sacks marked "MAIL".
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: DROP THAT SACK AND HOP OUT OF THAT CAR. I GOT ITCHY FINGERS SO GET MOVIN!!!
OKAY, LADY I GET YA!

cbml:panel.tei:note: A trainman tries to close the train-car door. Evelyn orders Pete to shoot him.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: STOP HIM! LET HIM HAVE IT! OOOF!
GET THE DOOR, PETE, QUICK!
GET AWAY FROM THAT DOOR!!

cbml:panel.tei:note: One trainman is shot as the other one raises his hands in surrender.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: I OUGHTTA PUT HOT LEAD THROUGH THAT FAT BELLY. GET DOWN OUTTA THERE BEFORE I LOSE MY SELF CONTROL.
EEEYAH!
MOVE! WE MEAN BUSINESS!
I'M COMING I'M COMING! DON'T SHOOT!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn points her pistol at the trainman with hands raised, while her gang work in the boxcar cabin.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: MAKE IT FAST, YOU GUYS! AFTER THAT SHOT THERE'S NO TELLING WHAT'LL HAPPEN. GET THE REGISTERED SACKS AND NOTHIN' ELSE.
OKAY, BABY COME ON TONY!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn forces her captive to crawl while coaxing more speed out of her gang members.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: GET DOWN ON YA BELLY YA FAT WORM, AND LET'S SEE YA CRAWL... HURRY IT UP IN THERE. YA WANTA SPEND THE NIGHT IN THE JUG?
TAKE IT EASY WILL YA, WE'RE WORKIN, AS FAST AS WE JUG? [sic]

cbml:panel.tei:note: Frankie loads the mail sacks into their car while Evelyn holds her hostage at gunpoint.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HEY, EVVIE, COME ON, WE'RE READY! CALL FRANK.
KEEP YA NOSE IN THE DIRT, BIG BOY IF YA DON'T WANT A HOLE IN YA HEAD .... FRANK COME ON!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn, gun in hand, moves away from the train with Frankie while the trainman calls for help.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HELP! ROBBERS! HELP!
I SHOULD OF KNOCKED HIS BRAINS OUT! LISTEN TO THE LOUD MOUTH!
AW, FORGET IT. WE GOT WHAT WE WAS AFTER DIDN'T WE?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady's disembodied head provides narrative.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THEY GOT AWAY WITHOUT LEAVING A CLUE AND SPLIT $67,OOO. EVELYN WAS IN HER GLORY. IN NO TIME SHE HAD PLANS FOR ANOTHER JOB, THIS TIME THE PINOLE BANK AT RODEO, CALIFORNIA..

cbml:panel.tei:note: Frankie and Evelyn talk in front of a building with an ornate sign, while other gang members handle weapons near their car.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: COME, ON, LET'S GET IT OVER WITH. ARE WE GONNA HANG AROUND HERE ALL DAY? LET'S GO!
WHAT'S THE MATTER, FRANKIE? LOSIN' YA NERVE? TAKE IT EASY , BOY, AND WE WON'T HAVE TROUBLE. I GOT THIS PLANNED RIGHT.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Inside the bank, Tony points his Thompson automatic menacingly while Evelyn and Frankie move toward the tellers' windows.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: DON'T MOVE, YOKELS, IF YA WANT TO KEEP LIVIN'!
FRANK, GET OVER TO THAT CAGE AND FILL THAT SACK.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Frankie points a gun at the bank-teller's nose, who, perspiring, shoves a wad of money into his hand. Evelyn, in the background, cows the bank customers.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: GET IT OUT OR I'LL DRILL YA!
Y... YES SIR!
EEEE!
CAN THAT NOISE LADY, OR YOU'LL WISH YOU HAD !

cbml:panel.tei:note: Frankie, large valise in one hand, and Evelyn, both with drawn weapons, back out of the bank entrance. A car sounds a siren.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YOU GOT EVERYTHING, FRANKIE, YOU... THE HORN! SOMEBODY'S COMING, LET'S BEAT IT!
I KNEW THIS WOULD HAPPEN!! COME ON!

cbml:panel.tei:note: With a gigantic yellow moon rising in the background, Evelyn guns down the sheriff.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: STOP, YOU THIEVING RATS! STOP OR ...AAAGH!
NO TIN HORN SHERIFF IS STOPPING US!
COME ON, GET IN THE CAR, WILL YA, EVELYN. COME ON!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn directs Tony to kill the wounded sheriff, slumped in the street.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HELP! I'LL GET YOU, YOU MURDEROUS SCUM... OHHH! IF I... HUH!.....
TONY, PUT THAT LOUSY COPPER OUT OF HIS MISERY! I MUST BE GETTING' CHICKEN HEARTED I CAN'T EVEN SEE ONE OF THEM RATS SUFFER.

cbml:panel.tei:note: An animated headshot of Tony as he fires his machine-gun at the wounded sheriff.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SO LONG, SHERIFF ITS BEEN NICE KNOWIN' YA. GIVE OUR REGARDS TO ST. PETER !
NO! NO! AAAGH!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn and Frankie talk animatedly in the backseat of their getaway car, while Joe gazes at them through the rearview mirror in the driver's seat.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: I'LL BET WE GOT TWENTY GRAND OUT OF THIS HAUL. I'LL MAKE BIG TIMERS OUT OF YOU CRUMBS YET.
YEAH AND WE KNOCKED OFF THE GUY. YA CAN GET THE GAS CHAMBER FOR THAT. I DON'T WANT TA FIND MYSELF IN NO HOT SEAT, CHOKIN' TO DEATH.
AW, SHUT UP. YOU GIMME THE CREEPS!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady's disembodied head provides narrative.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: AFTER THE BANK JOB EVELYN AND THE GANG LAID LOW FOR SEVERAL MONTHS, BUT SOON THE URGE FOR NEW TRIUMPHS HAD LITTLE EVVIE SCHEMING AGAIN, .. THIS TIME IT WAS $50,000 IN PAYROLL SHIPMENTS TO THE EAST. HER INFO CAME FROM A CORRUPT STATION AGENT.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Portrait shot of Evelyn speaking with the "corrupt station agent".
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: IT MUST BE INTERESTING WORKING AROUND TRAINS. THEY ALWAYS MAKE ME WONDER WHAT THEY CARRY AS THEY CHUG OUT OF THE CITY.
YOU'D BE SURPRISED, MISS. THAT ONE OVER THERE CARRIES OVER $50,000 IN CASH EVERY WEEK. THAT'S QUITE A CHUNK.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Similar shot, showing more of the station agent.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: GRACIOUS! I GUESS THEY GUARD IT WITH THEIR LIVES!
NO MORE THAN USUAL. ANY SMART CROOK COULD GET A CRACK AT IT. BUT, IF IT WAS UP TO ME... I'M ONLY THE AGENT WHAT AM I WORRYING ABOUT?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Similar shot, this time with Evelyn's hand on the door, the station agent gesturing with his hands.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WELL, I MUST BE GOING. YOU RAILROAD MEN ARE JUST TOO FASCINATING. GOODBYEE!
AW, YOU'RE JUST RUBBING [sic] ME GOODBY, SEE YOU AGAIN SOME TIME.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady's disembodied head provides narrative.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WITH THE INFORMATION SHE WORMED OUT OF THE AGENT EVELYN WAS ABLE TO PLAN THE MOST DARING OF ALL THE GANG'S JOBS A FEW LATER THEY WERE READY...

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn, sitting on a table, addresses Frankie who is wearing a trainman's outfit, with another gang member similarly attired, but head in shadow.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: NOW YOU KNOW WHAT TO DO. YOU GET ON THE TRAIN AND HAVE THEM STOP AT NOBEL. WE'LL BE WAITIN' FOR YA.
YA BETTER BE SURE YA GET 'EM STOPPED, FRANKIE, OR YA'LL END UP IN CHICAGO.
DON'T WORRY KID, WE'LL BE THERE ON THE NOSE, PACIFIC TIME.

cbml:panel.tei:note: At the train, Frankie is boarding the tender while two real trainmen discuss the novelty of the situation.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WHO'S THAT GUY CLIMBING ON THE TENDER?
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: AT THE STATION ONE HOUR LATER...
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: SEARCH ME, LOOKS LIKE ONE OF THE CREW. YOU'RE NOT WORRIED ABOUT BANDITS, ARE YOU? THAT GUY WOULDNT GET TO FIRST BASE.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Frankie, crouching on the coal heaped up in the tender, points a pistol at the train engineer and another trainman.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: ALL RIGHT YOU MONKEYS UP WITH YOUR HANDS AND NO FUNNY MOVES! I WANT YOU TO STOP THIS TRAIN AT NOBEL.
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: LATER NEAR NOBEL A WAY STOP NEAR SAN FRANCISCO...
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: ARE YOU NUTS BROTHER? THIS TRAIN RUNS ON A SPLIT SECOND SCHEDULE. WE COULDN'T DO THAT!
WHERE DID HE COME FROM?

cbml:panel.tei:note: Frankie threatens the trainmen in the boxcar.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YOU HEARD ME, I MEAN BUSINESS PAL, IF YOU WANT TO GET ANYWHERE AT ALL, YOU BETTER STOP AT NOBEL LIKE I SAID.
HEY... OKAY..I AIN'T ARGUING WITH ANY GUNS! THEY DIDN'T PAY ME FOR THAT!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn and Tony talk outside one of the motionless train boxcars.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: LOOKS LIKE FRANKIE MADE IT ON TIME. I ALWAYS SAID HE SHOULD WORK ON A RAILROAD.
HEY, EVVIE, THE CAR DOORS ARE LOCKED. I DON'T LIKE THIS.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Tony points his Tommie-gun at the boxcar door while Evelyn and Joe watch.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: OPEN THEM DOORS AND MAKE IT FAST. IF THEY AIN'T SLIDIN' IN TWO SECONDS, WE'LL... EEEE! WHY THEM! TONY. LET 'EM HAVE IT!
GOTCHA, KID!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Tableau of Evelyn, Tony and Joe firing their weapons, with a white/green/yellow bull's eye design in back.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: I DON'T CARE IF THEY'RE IN PIECES! GET THAT DOOR OPEN!
WE GIVE UP! STOP THAT FIRING AND WE'LL OPEN UP!
IF THEY DON'T COME OUT AFTER THIS, YOU DON'T HAVE TO WORRY THEY'LL BE DEAD.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Evelyn directs the action as Tony hefts his machine gun, two trainmen in back with upraised hands.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: GET THOSE SACKS OUT. BOYS, IN TEN MINUTES EVERY DICK IN THE COUNTRY WILL BE SWARMIN' ALL OVER THE PLACE... JOE WATCH THESE MUGS!

cbml:panel.tei:note: In a different part of the train, Tony and Joe unload the mail sacks while Evelyn and Frankie converse.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: NICE WORK, SWEETY, YOU WERE ON THE SECOND!
IT WAS A CINCH, KID, NOT EVEN BACK TALK..GET OVER BY THEM CLERKS AND KEEP YA YAPS SHUT!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Tony, silhouetted, threatens the trainmen (and Frankie?) with his gun as they load the mail sacks into the getaway car. Evelyn's profile face is half the size of the panel.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: STEP ON IT, CHUMS, YOU WON'T BE HOLDIN' BACK ON ME WOULD YA?
ANY OF THEM GET WISE, GIVE IT TO 'EM!
YIII!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Tony, probably, tells Evelyn that the last sack has been loaded, with a confirmation from Frankie. The perspective is that of the captured trainmen.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THIS IS THE LAST OF 'EM. YA READY TO BEAT IT?
YEAH, THE QUICKER WE TAKE A POWDER, THE BETTER. COME ON, LET'S GO!

cbml:panel.tei:note: As the getaway car speeds off, Tony, shooting from an open window, guns down a trainman.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: CUT THAT OUT, TONY! YA GETTING' TRIGGER HAPPY?
NAW, I JUST DON'T WANT THEM GUYS TO GET A PEEK AT OUR LICENSE PLATES!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady's disembodied head provides narrative.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: AGAIN, THEY MADE A PERFECT GETAWAY LEAVING NO CLUE, OR SO THEY THOUGHT. BUT THIS TIME THE ENGINEER OF THE TRAIN HAD NOTICED SOMETHING!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Office scene: the chief of police sits at his desk, gesturing with a pencil, while the train engineer, leaning on his desk, points out the window at the cityscape. Detective Phil stands in the door while a cop in uniform leans against a filing cabinet.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: AS I WAS TELLING YOU THE ONLY THING I RECOGNIZED WAS A TAN '37 CHRYSER SEDAN.
THAT'S MIGHTY SLIM STUFF, BUT YOU CAN NEVER TELL..PHIL COME HERE!

cbml:panel.tei:note: The scene now takes place from the engineer's former vantage point: the chief of police points his pencil at Phil, who is shifting his fedora with one hand in thought, while the engineer now stands in the background.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: PHIL, I WANT YOU TO HAVE EVERY 1937 TAN CHRYSER SEDAN IN THE BAY AREA CHECKED AND FIND OUT WHO OWNS THEM.
PHEW, CHIEF, THAT'S A ROUGH ORDER! I'LL GET THE BOYS ON IT RIGHT AWAY!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady's disembodied head provides narrative.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THE BOYS HAD A REAL JOB, BUT THEY WENT TO AND LITTLE BY LITTLE THE SEARCH NARROWED DOWN TILL THE POLICE DISCOVERED A TAN CHRYSLER OWNED BY FRANK ELLIS. FROM THEN ON IT WAS A CINCH AND THEN ONE DAY...

cbml:panel.tei:note: Detective Phil raps on a closed apartment door, a bit of lathe showing where the plaster has fallen off, with two uniformed policemen in attendance.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YOU'RE IN THERE, OPEN UP OR WE'RE COMING IN AFTER YOU. BETTER GIVE UP WHILE YOU CAN!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Detective Phil holds his service revolver while the two uniformed cops bash in the door with brute force.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THERE SHE GOES! WATCH YOURSELVES, BOYS, THEY'RE PROBABLY SITTING IN THERE WAITING TO TAKE A POT SHOT AT YOU!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Bullets whiz through the broken door as the policemen duck.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: PUT THOSE GUNS DOWN, YOU FILTHY RATS! YOU'RE SURROUNDED! YOU HAVEN'T GOT A CHANCE!
LET ME GIVE THOSE SKUNKS THE GAS. THEY'LL COME OUT IN A HURRY ALL RIGHT!

cbml:panel.tei:note: A policeman lobs a tear-gas canister through the splintered door.
Scene from within the apartment: clouds of gas swirl around Evelyn and Frankie as they stumble towards the broken door. Only the hats of Phil and a policeman are visible outside the door.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: DON'T SHOOT! (COUGH) WE GIVE UP (GASP) DON'T SHOOT!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: MOMENTS LATER...
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: DON'T (GASP) KILL US! (COUGH) DON'T SHOOT!
LOOK AT THEM, LIKE RATS COMING OUT OF A SINKING SHIP!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Outside the apartment, Frankie is being hand-cuffed in the apartment hallway by a uniformed policeman as Phil tells "Phil" [sic] to have the house watched.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: ALL RIGHT PHIL, PUT A GUARD ON THE HOUSE AND BRING IN ANYONE ELSE THAT SHOWS UP. I'LL GET THESE BIRDS DOWN TOWN I WANT TO HEAR HOW THEY SING.
RIGHT, MAYBE WE CAN PICK UP A FEW MORE FOR THE CAGE!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Behind a tree, Tony and Joe watch warily as Evelyn and Frankie are being led away by the police in front of a brick walk-up. The sun is shining, causing the group to cast shadows on the sidewalk.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: JOE! LOOK! THE COPS GOT EVELYN AND FRANKIE! LET'S BLOW!
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: MEANWHILE.... JOE AND TONY RETURN TO THE HOUSE.....
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YA THINK THAT'S SMART TONY? THAT FRANKIE'S GONNA SQUEAL

cbml:panel.tei:note: Joe and Tony walk down a sidewalk with backs to the viewer. A huge moon rises -- is this a deliberate time marker or simply carelessness on the part of the inker?
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: YA RIGHT, JOE. EVVIE'LL KEEP HER TRAP SHUT. BUT FRANKIE, HE'S TOO YELLOW. LISTEN, I GOT AN IDEA. LET'S FOLLOW THEM DOWN TO THE STATION AND SEE WHAT DEVELOPS! NO COP'LL LOOK FOR US THERE.
YEA ! I THINK MAYBE YA GOT SOMETHIN'. LET'S GO !

cbml:panel.tei:note: Joe and Tony see Frankie being booked in the police precinct.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WE GOTTA STOP THAT GUY FROM STOOLING. LISTEN, HERE'S WHAT WE DO. SEE, WE GO OVER TO THE DOOR AND.....
cbml:panel.cbml:caption: AT THE POLICE STATION.....
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: LOOK, TONY THEY'RE BOOKING THE WEASEL NOW.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Silhouetted in the street doorway, Joe and Tony point guns toward the police as Frankie turns in their direction.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: RUN, FRANKIE, RUN. WE GOT YA COVERED. COME ON!
GET GOING, FRANKIE WE'RE GONNA SPRING YA!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Frankie runs furiously towards the door as Joe and Tony back away, guns levelled. The police gesture angrily.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: HEY STOP!
COME BACK HERE! WHERE DO YOU THINK YOU'RE GOING?
THOSE DUMB FLATFOOTS. IT'S WORKIN' LIKE A CHARM. WE'LL PLUG HIM WHEN HE HITS THE DOOR. THEY'LL BE SO SURPRISED WE'LL BE ABLE TO GET AWAY.

cbml:panel.tei:note: Frankie raises his hands when he understands his predicament, dapper Joe with his leopard print hatband, necktie and pocket handkerchief glaring balefully.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: OKAY FELLAS, YA WAS JUST... EEEYAH!
WE WOULDN'T WANT YA TO TURN STOOLIE, PAL!
YA SHOULDN'T HAVE BEEN PICKED UP, FRANKIE. WE'RE NOT TAKIN' ANY CHANCES!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Standing over the slain Frankie, a policeman cuts down the fleeing Joe and Tony.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THERE THEY GO, THE MURDERIN' SCUM!
JOE, JOE, THEY'RE AFTER US!
YIII! THEY'LL MASSACRE US!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Tony's limp hand in the foreground, the fleeing Joe staggers as he is peppered with police bullets in the back.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THEY MUST HAVE BEEN NUTS COMIN' RIGHT TO THE STATION TO GET THE GUY!
WE'LL [sic] THEY'LL NOT GET ANYBODY ELSE FROM NOW ON. THE SNEAKIN'S SKUNKS!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Two uniformed policemen stand over the corpses of the Ellis Gang members, the background lurid red like blood.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: THEY'RE TWO MORE FROM THE ELLIS GANG, THE CAPTAIN WILL BE GLAD TO HEAR IT. SAVES A LOT OF TROUBLE ROUNDING THEM UP.
YEAH, AND THE STATE SAVES THE EXPENSE OF A TRIAL. THEY ALWAYS END UP THE SAME WAY,..DEAD!

cbml:panel.tei:note: Phantom Lady's disembodied head, grinning remorselessly, straddles the gutter between the final two panels.
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon: WELL THAT ENDED EVELYN'S WILD SPREE OF MURDER AND ROBBERY. THE OTHER MEMBER OF THE GANG WAS SOON CAUGHT AND GIVEN LIFE. EVELYN WAS SENTENCED TO FIFTY YEARS AS HER SHARE. CRIME JUST DOES NOT PAY! I'VE GOT TO GET BACK NOW AND MEET DAD, WE'RE INVITED TO MEET A NEW AMBASSADOR WHO'S TALL DARK AND TERRIFIC. SEE YOU NEXT MONTH WITH ANOTHER EXCITING TRUE CRIME STORY, RIGHT FROM THE POLICE FILES. BYE NOW!
